Pierre was staying at Prince Vasili Kurdgin's and sharing the dissipated life of his son Ana- tole, the son whom they were planning to re- form by marrying him to Prince Andrew's sister. 
"Do you know?" said Pierre, as if suddenly struck by a happy thought, "seriously, I have long been thinking of it. ... Leading such a life I can't decide or think properly about any- thing. One's head aches, and one spends all one's money. He asked me for tonig
